alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Guernsey; Monroe; Muskingum; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 23 at 7:19PM EDT until March 23 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL GUERNSEY...NORTHWESTERN MONROE...SOUTHEASTERN MUSKINGUM...SOUTHWESTERN BELMONT AND NORTHERN NOBLE COUNTIES... At 719 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Caldwell, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Cambridge, Barnesville, Caldwell, Byesville, Dudley, Antrim, Quaker City, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Beallsville, Cumberland, and Lore City. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
